name: Number of states involved in conflicts - Conflict type: one-sided violence
descriptionShort: Included are states that were primary participants in at least one instance of one-sided violence that year.

presentation.attribution: Uppsala Conflict Data Program and Peace Research Institute Oslo (2025)

descriptionKey: One-sided violence is defined by the [Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP)](https://ucdp.uu.se/) as the use of armed force by a state or non-state armed group against civilians that causes at least 25 civilian deaths during a year.
A country is considered to participate in a conflict if they were a primary participant, which refers to those participants that have the main disagreement of the conflict.

origins.title: Georeferenced Event Dataset
origins.description:
This dataset is UCDP's most disaggregated dataset, covering individual events of organized violence (phenomena of lethal violence occurring at a given time and place). These events are sufficiently fine-grained to be geo-coded down to the level of individual villages, with temporal durations disaggregated to single, individual days.

You can find more notes at https://ucdp.uu.se/downloads/ged/ged251.pdf
origins.citationFull:
Davies, S., Pettersson, T., Sollenberg, M., & Öberg, M. (2025). Organized violence 1989–2024, and the challenges of identifying civilian victims. Journal of Peace Research, 62(4).

Sundberg, Ralph and Erik Melander (2013) Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).

origins.title: Armed Conflict
origins.description:
A conflict-year dataset with information on armed conflict where at least one party is the government of a state in the time period 1946-2024.

You can find more notes at https://ucdp.uu.se/downloads/ucdpprio/ucdp-prio-acd-251.pdf
origins.producer: Uppsala Conflict Data Program and Peace Research Institute Oslo
origins.citationFull:
Davies, S., Pettersson, T., Sollenberg, M., & Öberg, M. (2025). Organized violence 1989–2024, and the challenges of identifying civilian victims. Journal of Peace Research, 62(4).

Gleditsch, Nils Petter, Peter Wallensteen, Mikael Eriksson, Margareta Sollenberg, and Håvard Strand (2002) Armed Conflict 1946-2001: A New Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 39(5).
